issues.description: The problem statement describes the GET /persons endpoint as returning a Set of all persons (problem_statement.md lines 21-23), but both the template and solution implementations define the controller method getAllPersons() to return a List<Person> (template: template_repository/src/main/java/de/tum/in/ase/eist/rest/PersonResource.java lines 27-30; solution: solution_repository/src/main/java/de/tum/in/ase/eist/rest/PersonResource.java lines 27-30). This mismatch between the documented return collection type (Set) and the actual method return type (List) can confuse students about the expected API contract and the data structure they should use in tests/implementations.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the description and the code consistent. Either (a) update the problem statement to state that GET /persons returns a List<Person> (preferred, since the controller currently returns List<Person>), or (b) change the controller method signature and return value to return a Set<Person> in both template and solution if the exercise intends to require a Set. Ensure tests and examples in the statement match the chosen collection type.
